summary: The Saving the Department of the Interior's Workforce Act (S. 2597) places a moratorium on reductions in force (RIFs) at all agencies and bureaus within the Department of the Interior until the full-year appropriations for fiscal year 2026 are enacted. The Secretary of the Interior is prohibited from initiating or implementing RIFs and conducting involuntary separations of employees (except for cause) in the competitive, excepted, and Senior Executive Service. The bill cites relevant sections of the United States Code defining these terms.
